H0.text: Increasing strength for moving around in the cabin is the best reason for exercising on space flights.

H1.text: To keep from becoming overweight on a space mission is the best reason for exercising on space flights.

H2.text: Minimizing the loss of muscle mass due to microgravity is the best reason for exercising on space flights.

H3.text: Ensuring that bodily fluids do not tend to collect in the feet is the best reason for exercising on space flights.

A4.text: In humans, prolonged periods of immobilization, as in the cases of bed rest or astronauts flying in space, are known to result in muscle weakening and atrophy.

A5.text: The rate of muscle atrophy from disuse (10–42 days) is approximately 0.5–0.6% of total muscle mass per day although there is considerable variation between people.
